intro: Amischotolype scandens, commonly known as the climbing amischotolype, is a flowering plant native to parts of Asia. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes many species of shrubs and vines. The plant is characterized by its twining stems and opposite leaves with serrated edges. Its small, white to pale yellow flowers are clustered in umbels, and it produces small, spherical berries that are edible. Amischotolype scandens is often found in moist, shaded environments such as forests and along stream banks.
